setting.name: global-address
setting.label: Public Address
setting.description: Set this if your ITSP requires a globally routable address to be specificed and if you do not wish to use STUN to determine that address. If you enter a public address here, any STUN settings will be ignored.

setting.name: global-port
setting.label: Public Port
setting.description: Set this if your ITSP requires you to specify a publicly routable ITSP facing port.

setting.name: external-address
setting.label: External address
setting.description: The ITSP facing address. This is the NATed public address. If you have only one interface on your machine it will be the same as your local address.

setting.name: external-port
setting.label: External port
setting.description: The ITSP facing port on your machine. This is the NATed global port.

setting.name: local-address
setting.description: The SIPX proxy facing address. The SIPX proxy will send signaling here.

setting.name: local-port
setting.description: The SIPX proxy facing port. The SIPX proxy will send signaling here.

setting.name: sipx-proxy-domain
setting.description: The sipXecs proxy domain.

setting.name: stun-server-address
setting.label: STUN server
setting.description: The stun server address used to determine the global address of the bridge. If you enter a static global address, this field is ignored.

setting.name: sip-keepalive-seconds
setting.label: Signaling keep-alive interval
setting.description: Keepalive timer for SIP Signaling. sipXbridge will re-register with each ITSP to keep the NAT pinhole open

setting.name: media-keepalive-seconds
setting.label: Media keep-alive interval
setting.description: Keepalive timer for RTP. Each RTP stream facing the ITSP will start a timer that runs with this timeout (in seconds). If packets are not seen in the specified interval, the keepalive timer will send packets.

setting.name: xml-rpc-port
setting.label: API port
setting.description: Port for external XML/RPC requests to be directed. If not specified, the XML RPC server is not started. The XML RPC interface is used by sipxconfig to report status to the user.

setting.name: max-number-of-concurrent-calls
setting.label: Maximum calls
setting.description: The maximum number of concurrent calls allowed via the given bridge overall. When the limit is reached, sipxbridge will return "Service Unavailable". If nothing is specified, no limit is placed on the max number of concurrent calls.

setting.name: music-on-hold-support-enabled
setting.label: Music on hold
setting.description: If checked sipXbridge Music On Hold support is enabled. Phones should disable their MOH support if sipXbridge support for MOH is enabled.

setting.name: rtp-port-range-start
setting.label: Start RTP port
setting.description: Start of the RTP ports range.

setting.name: rtp-port-range-end
setting.label: End RTP port
setting.description: End of the RTP ports range.

setting.name: is-reinvite-supported
setting.label: re-INVITE Support
setting.description: If checked, re-INVITE is supported by the ITSP. This allows sipxbridge to delay codec choice for call setup when dealing with call transfers and can give you a wider range of codecs to chose from.

setting.name: allowed-codec-name
setting.label: Allowed Codec Name
setting.description: The codec for the SDP Offer that is allowable. This parameter is ONLY relevant if the ITSPs do NOT support ReINVITE. Otherwise it is ignored. If is-reinvite-supported flag is set to "false" then SDP offers and answers are filtered to allow only this codec through.

setting.name: route-inbound-calls-to-extension
setting.label: Incoming calls destination
setting.description: Determines where to send inbound calls. If empty, inbound calls are directly routed to the specified number in the inbound request and have to be redirected by aliases or dial plan rules.

setting.name: log-level
setting.label: Logging level
setting.description: Log configuration. Defaults to INFO level.

setting.name: log-directory
setting.description: Log directory. The log file name is hard coded to "sipxbridge.log".
